pullRequest.body:
This PR removes most of the material on BitVec. While it is being actively developed in Lean, we do not want conflicting, but essentially unused, material here causing conflicts.

If downstream users of Mathlib find that they need some of this material is being used, they are advised to either:
* restore the material in their downstream repository
* ask someone from the FRO, e.g. @semorrison, about making a PR adding it to the Lean library.



---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9320326738/job/25656882474)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9320326738/job/25656881779)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9320326738/job/25656882257)

While most of these files are indeed results that should be in core after the move, this particular instance is about `CommSemiring`, a Mathlib typeclass, and thus should remain in Mathlib.

I'd be happy to open PRs to core for the results that this instance depends on that you feel don't belong in Mathlib

Moreover, we in fact have a [`CommRing` instance](https://github.com/opencompl/ssa/blob/ec6e647cd91936509e372d1615e95aab7415fe8c/SSA/Projects/InstCombine/ForMathlib.lean#L51-L54) which we use for [proof automation](https://github.com/opencompl/ssa/blob/ec6e647cd91936509e372d1615e95aab7415fe8c/SSA/Projects/InstCombine/TacticAuto.lean#L70-L83) that we would eventually like to re-home into `mathlib`.

In fact, most proofs that this instance depends on are just def-eqs, so we can inline them if we really don't want those results in mathlib.

Here's a relatively minimal file that retains the `CommSemiring` instance:
```lean4
/-
Copyright (c) 2020 Simon Hudon. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Simon Hudon, Harun Khan, Alex Keizer
-/
import Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.InjSurj
import Mathlib.Data.ZMod.Defs

/-!
# Basic Theorems About Bitvectors

This file contains theorems about bitvectors.
-/

namespace BitVec

variable {w v : Nat}

theorem toFin_injective {n : Nat} : Function.Injective (toFin : BitVec n  _)
  | _, _, _, _, rfl => rfl

/-!
## Ring
-/

instance : SMul  (BitVec w) := fun x y => ofFin <| x  y.toFin
instance : SMul  (BitVec w) := fun x y => ofFin <| x  y.toFin
instance : Pow (BitVec w)   := fun x n => ofFin <| x.toFin ^ n

instance : CommSemiring (BitVec w) :=
  toFin_injective.commSemiring _ rfl rfl toFin_add toFin_mul (fun _ _ => rfl)
    (fun _ _ => rfl) (fun _ => rfl)

end BitVec
```
@alexkeizer, do you want to just push that to this PR?

> In fact, most proofs that this instance depends on are just def-eqs, so we can inline them if we really don't want those results in mathlib.

Dropping the defeq lemmas seems like a bad idea to me. If mathlib is providing the definitions (`Pow`/`SMul` etc), then it should provide the defeq lemmas as well.

The defeq lemmas about things like `^^^` which are themselves defined upstream should probably migrate upstream.

I've now pushed a version of the file I commented which keeps `toFin_nsmul`, `toFin_zsmul` and `toFin_pow`, plus the results about `Function.Injective`.
The other def-eqs, `toFin_zero`, `toFin_one`, and `toFin_natCast` I've condensed into a single morally equivalent lemma `toFin_ofNat`, and PR'd upstream at https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/4298
I've merged https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/4298
Thanks for the push.
I think anything about `Function.Injective` should be kept, since we can't _state_ those lemmas any further upstream
That should be stated downstream of Mathlib, not upstream.
Repeating a comment that was made privately; we should keep the `#align`s around, at least as long as we keep any `align`s around.
I've restored the #aligns, turning them into #noalign when something is being deleted.
Thanks!
Arguably these `def` should become `@[deprecated] alias`es before we remove them outright, but perhaps no one cares.
We still want these `proof_wanted`s, right?
No.

I think we might: these statements use an instance of `IntCast (Fin (2^w))`. This instance is defined in Mathlib, and comes from `AddGroupWithOne`. Even if we upstream just the generic instance (https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Int/Cast/Defs.html#Int.castDef), which is quite doable, we then run into the issue that the instance for `Fin n` requires an `NeZero n` assumption. IIRC, we don't (yet) want `NeZero` upstream. I guess we could special case an instance for `Fin (2^w)`, which would be enough to state these particular theorems upstream, but this feels a bit ad-hoc to me.

And we do really want these theorems, since they are required for the aforementioned `CommRing` instance and the proof automation it buys us.
I think the decision is that these can just be done downstream for now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove most of the material on BitVec
